What Is Newfold Digital?

Newfold Digital is a large hosting corporation, founded in 1997 with headquarters in Burlington, Massachusetts.

Formerly known as BizLand and later as The Endurance International Group (EIG), the company has a simple ‚Äî yet effective business model that has seen it buy other brands up, amass them together, and grown everything into the impressive giant it is today.

This business model involves the buying and acquisition of companies in the hosting, domain management, search, social media and email marketing niches.

The acquired brands, under this style, are absorbed into the holding of the parent company, EIG (now Newfold Digital).

This means that management changes ‚Äî and usually, the IT infrastructure of such companies is moved to India ‚Äî irrespective of where they were hitherto situated.

However, the acquired companies and brands continue to operate under their earlier known names and identities.

Essentially thus, what changes for a company when EIG acquires it is its management and the relocation of its IT infrastructure.

EIG, on its own end, explains the rationale for this business move thus: ‚ÄúOur mission is as simple as it is aspirational: to bring together technology, people, products, and data to create solutions that help small businesses succeed‚Äù.

Why Do Many Webmasters Hate The Newfold Digital (Formerly EIG) Hosting Options With A Passion So Rare?

The quest for hosting companies or options not owned by Newfold Digital is huge ‚Äî and growing by the day.

This growing distraught on the EIG brands has seen non-EIG hosting companies take pains to clear the air that they are still very independent and as a matter of fact, are privately owned (read: not Newfold Digital owned or controlled).

However, it is important to address a very important issue at this point: why is the Newfold Digital brand hated this much by webmasters, bloggers, and hosting professionals?

The reason is simple; the answer is not far-fetched.

The ‚Äòconglomerate‚Äô, over the years, has mastered the act of acquiring smaller brands and companies, merging them with the larger Newfold family and ruining them completely, in the process.

In defense of Newfold though, the ‚Äòconglomerate‚Äô does not go out of its way to ruin these hitherto awesome companies: rather, it is the manner in which the companies are run after Newfold‚Äôs acquisition that sees customers and the rest of the world (read: non-Newfold folks) complaining.

Now, how are companies run when they become part of the EIG family?

It‚Äôs fairly simple ‚Äî at least, on surface value: first, such a company‚Äôs IT infrastructure is moved to India where the conglomerate maintains an impressive presence.

The staff may be maintained ‚Äî together with the management.

However, the overall philosophy and direction of such a company significantly change: the focus is strictly on productivity and profit and generally not on offering the best possible service that can be got!

It is this shift in philosophy (when Newfold takes over a company) that makes webmasters, bloggers, and other professionals have a general dislike for Newfold Digital-controlled brands.

It is also this dislike that has made you, today, seek out the very best hosting companies that are not Newfold owned or controlled.
